twcore.core.command
Class TempSettingsManager

java.lang.Object
  twcore.core.command.TempSettingsManager

public class TempSettingsManager
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides an easy way to allow an op to modify temporary settings. The TempSettingsManager (TSM) interfaces with the bot and keeps track of all the TempSettings. Settings are identified by name and are no longer case-sensitive. There are now multiple ways to interface chat messages with the TSM:

  • Register !get and !set with a supplied CommandInterpreter
  • Pass the chat message to it with handleEvent
  • Filter the chat messages yourself and call c_Set and c_Get directly
As of this version, the types of settings you can store are integers, doubles, booleans, strings, players, and enumerated types in the form of a list of strings. On the command side, you can assign values using the form !set name1=value1 name2=value2 ... For strings that contain spaces or non-alphanumeric characters, you can enclose the value in quotes. If at certain points during the execution of your bot you do not want settings to be changed from the command interface, you can use the locking system to either lock settings individually or you can lock the entire TSM at once. If your bot needs to be notified when a bot operator modifies one of the settings through the command interface, have it implement TSChangeListener and subscribe with the TSM to get the settingChanged callback.

Version:
06.06.01
Author:
D1st0rt

                           CommandInterpreter cmd,

opLevel - The minimum Operator Level to access the settings

TempSettingsManager

public TempSettingsManager(BotAction botAction,
                           int opLevel)
Creates a new instance of TempSettingsManager. Use this Constructor when you don't want to use a CommandInterpreter. Note that if you do use this constructor you will have to pass screen your messages and pass the commands manually to cSet() and c_Get().

Parameters:
botAction - The BotAction event to send chat messages with
opLevel - The minimum Operator Level to access the settings

addSetting

public void addSetting(java.lang.String name)
Adds a Player setting into the list, enabling it for use. The default value for this setting is null.

Parameters:
name - The name of the setting to be added

removeSetting

                            int min,
                            int max)
This is used for when you want to restrict an integer setting within a certain range of numbers

Parameters:
name - The name of the setting to restrict
min - The minimum value to allow
max - The maximum value to allow

restrictPlayerSettingFreq

public void restrictPlayerSettingFreq(java.lang.String name,
                                      int min,
                                      int max)
This is used for when you want to restrict a Player setting within a certain range of frequencies (inclusive)

Parameters:
name - The name of the setting to restrict
min - The minimum frequency >= 0 to allow
max - The maximum frequency <= 9999 to allow

restrictPlayerSettingShip

public void restrictPlayerSettingShip(java.lang.String name,
                                      int ship,
                                      boolean ok)
Sets whether or not a setting can be set to a player in a particular ship, where ship ranges from 0 (warbird) to 7 (shark).

Parameters:
name - The name of the setting to restrict
ship - the ship to change the value for
ok - whether the ship is allowed or not

getSetting

public java.lang.Object getSetting(java.lang.String name)
Gets a setting by name, this is for when you need to access the value in the code of your bot.

Parameters:
name - The name of the setting to retrieve
Returns:
The setting contained in an Object, ready for casting :D

setValue

public Result setValue(java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String arg)
This changes the value of a setting, with an optional message being returned

Parameters:
name - The name of the setting to change
arg - The new value you want for the setting
Returns:
A message describing the success or failure of the set attempt

handleEvent

public void handleEvent(Message event)
This takes an incoming chat message and screens it for use in the TempSettingsManager. It will pass the message to the appropriate function when necessary.

Parameters:
event - the chat message to check for delivery

c_Set

public void c_Set(java.lang.String name,
                  java.lang.String message)
This is the command function registered with the CommandInterpreter under !set

Parameters:
name - The name of the player that sent the message
message - The parameters sent along after "!set"

c_Get

public void c_Get(java.lang.String name,
                  java.lang.String message)
This is the command function registered with the CommandInterpreter under !get

Parameters:
name - The name of the player that sent the message
message - The parameters sent along after "!get"

setLocked

public void setLocked(java.lang.String name,
                      boolean locked)
This locks/unlocks settings from being modified through the command interface (!set)

Parameters:
name - The name of the setting to set locked or unlocked
locked - Whether settings should be locked or unlocked

setAllLocked

public void setAllLocked(boolean locked)
This locks/unlocks all settings from being modified through the command interface (!set) Individual command locks are preserved, but if you setAllLocked(true), it overrides any non-locked commands.

Parameters:
locked - Whether settings should be locked or unlocked

addTSChangeListener

public void addTSChangeListener(TSChangeListener t)
Registers a TSChangeListener with the TempSettingsManager. Any time a setting is changed through the command interface, the registered listeners will receive the settingChanged callback.

Parameters:
t - the listener to add

removeTSChangeListener

public void removeTSChangeListener(TSChangeListener t)
Removes a TSChangeListener from receiving settingChanged callbacks.

Parameters:
t - the listener to remove

setCustomHelp

public void setCustomHelp(java.lang.String[] customHelp)
Allows the bot to specify a custom message for !set help. To revert back to the default, pass a null object. For no message, pass a new String[0]

Parameters:
customHelp - the custom help message to display
